column4: What is the recommended way of backing up my ubuntu system? Is there software that works great for backups?
SBackup
S stands for Simple ;)
If I know I just want a complete backup of my entire hd, you recommend anything?
dd or tar? I suggest to take look at sbackup
Let's say I have one HD, and I want to add another and make a RAID 1. Can that be done, even though one HD is currently empty ?
it's different case -> wait 5 min...
You can google yourself, but basicly it goes like this:

1) create partition with raid autodetect type; 2) create raid1 with one missing partition; 3) create FS on raid; 4) mount && copy data from existing partition to raid; 5) change original partition to raid and add it to raid.
Thank you for that. Back to the backups, if I just want a complete backup of my system, will sbackup achieve that if I copy / and all sub-dir? Won't that miss the filesystem tables?
sbackup is for backuping data files. trageted for endusers and not whole system backup. try simple tar
So, for my entire system backup, use tar?
yap. use tar. but i moved two systems to Raid1 w/o problems (and backups) ;)
I'm going to try and move my system to raid 1 but i want a backup too ;)
I just done this: tar cvpzf backup.tgz --exclude=/proc --exclude=/lost+found --exclude=/backup.tgz --exclude=/mnt --exclude=/sys /
actualy it's waste of time and disk space to backup programm files as you always can reinstall them ;)
Which files do you mean?
Why is it a waste of time. If I need to completely restore my system, it'll have everything I want.
I backup only /etc /home and /var/www.
I see. but I want my system the way it is now, without the need to re-install everything by apt :)
finished move to raid1?
